items.title: Directed TxPool
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: Transactions will be forwarded directly to a few validators who are most likely to produce the next block. It is another key aspect of VDN, transactions that are broadcasted in VDN would no long be gossip based, on the opposite, they will only be broadcasted to next {N} validators which have the highest priority to propose the next block. The value of {N} is configurable, by default {N} could be t...

items.title: Validator Dedicated Network
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This is a new network topology that only accepts validators or nodes authorized by validators. The general network topology can be described by the following diagram:...

items.title: Short Block Interval Phase Two: 0.75 seconds
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: Shorten the block interval from 1.5 seconds to 0.75 seconds to enable faster transaction confirmation and improve user experience. BEP-520 is the phase one to reduce the block interval from 3 seconds to 1.5 seconds. And this BEP is the phase two, which would reduce it further to 0.75 seconds....

items.title: Short Block Interval Phase One: 1.5 seconds
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: Shorten the block interval from 3 seconds to 1.5 seconds to enable faster transaction confirmation and improve user experience. Since its inception, BSC has maintained a 3-second block interval. Shortening this interval can provide quicker transaction confirmations, enhancing user experience. However, this modification presents challenges that require adjustments to the consensus mechanism and net...

items.title: Implement EIP-7623: Increase calldata cost
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: * [Specification](#specification) * [Backwards Compatibility](#backwards-compatibility)...

items.title: Make the block header format compatible with EIP-7685
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: The goal is to make the block header format compatible with EIP-7685. This allows for shared codebases and APIs between implementations, promoting consistency and interoperability. In line with EIP-7685, the header is extended with a new 32-byte commitment value, `requests_hash`. On BSC:...

items.title: Implement EIP-7702: Set EOA account code
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: Add a new transaction type that adds a list of `[chain_id, address, nonce, y_parity, r, s]` authorization tuples. For each tuple, write a delegation designator `(0xef0100 || address)` to the signing account's code. All code executing operations must load the code pointed to by the designator. There is a lot of interest in adding short-term functionality improvements to EOAs, increasing the usabili...

items.title: Implement EIP-2935: Serve historical block hashes from state
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: Store last `HISTORY_SERVE_WINDOW` historical block hashes in the storage of a system contract as part of the block processing logic. Furthermore this EIP has no impact on `BLOCKHASH` resolution mechanism (and hence its range/costs etc). EVM implicitly assumes the client has the recent block (hashes) at hand. This assumption is not future-proof given the prospect of stateless clients. Including the...

items.title: Implement EIP-2537: Precompile for BLS12-381 curve operations
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: Add functionality to efficiently perform operations over the BLS12-381 curve, including those for BLS signature verification. Along with the curve arithmetic, multi-scalar-multiplication operations are included to efficiently aggregate public keys or individual signer's signatures during BLS signature verification....

items.title: Paymaster API Spec for EOA Wallets
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: Unlike the paymaster defined in EIP-4337, this proposal introduces a paymaster solution specifically tailored for EOA (Externally Owned Account) wallets, along with standardized paymaster APIs. With minimal modifications, wallets can integrate paymasters that implement these API standards, enabling users to send transactions with zero gas fees. Under [BEP322](https://github.com/bnb-chain/BEPs/blob...

items.title: Add Agent for Validators
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP attempts to enhance the security of validator account management through account isolation by delegating some of the validator operator's permissions to other accounts. Currently, validators need to manage the operator key, consensus key, and vote key. Among these, the operator key is used for operating a validator, including creating a validator, editing the information of a validator, a...

items.title: Clear Miner History when Switching Validators Set
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: After switching the validator set on the BSC chain, the previous block production record is still used to restrict some validators from producing blocks for the first few blocks after the switch, leading to brief network instability. This BEP aims to resolve this issue. The validator set on the BSC chain switches at each epoch....

items.title: Complete Missing Fields in Block Header to Generate Signature
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: Since the London upgrade on the BSC chain, 5 new fields have been added to the block header, but these fields are not used when generating the block signature. As a result, users cannot guarantee that these new fields have not been tampered with after only verifying the signature. This BEP aims to address this issue. After a block producer mines a block, they first encode all fields in the block h...

items.title: Greenfield Atomic Object Update
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: <!-- @import "[TOC]" {cmd="toc" depthFrom=1 depthTo=6 orderedList=false} --> This proposal seeks to enhance the efficiency and reliability of object modifications in the Greenfield network by introducing...

items.title: Primary Storage Provider acts as the upload agent for object creation and update on Greenfield
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP introduces a new method where the primary storage provider (SP) acts as the upload agent for creating objects in Greenfield. It allows users to send objects directly to the primary SP without sending transactions on chain. The primary SP will then create the object on-chain on behalf of the user, eliminating the requirement for users to switch over to the Greenfield network and incur gas ...

items.title: Greenfield Storage Fee Paymaster
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: The BEP introduces a storage fee paymaster solution for sponsors to cover storage costs on Greenfield, making it easier for regular users to utilize the platform. Currently, users need to pay the storage fee for the buckets by themselves,...

items.title: Streamline off-chain authentication on Greenfield
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP introduces GNFD2-EDDSA, a simplified off-chain authentication signature verification method. It streamlines the authentication process, reducing developer integration complexity and improving user interaction. Greenfield is an object storage system with permission management. SP uses an off-chain authentication mechanism to authenticate users from the dApps. For more details, refer to [Gr...

items.title: Implement EIP-7516: BLOBBASEFEE opcode
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: As part of Cancun upgrade, EIP-7516: BLOBBASEFEE opcode is required to be implemented to BSC. Add a `BLOBBASEFEE (0x4a)` that returns the value of the blob base-fee of the current block it is executing in. It is the identical to [EIP-3198](./BEP227.md) (`BASEFEE` opcode) except that it returns the blob base-fee as per [EIP-4844](./BEP-336.md)....

items.title: Implement EIP-6780: SELFDESTRUCT only in same transaction
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: As part of Cancun upgrade, Implement EIP-6780: SELFDESTRUCT only in same transaction is required to be implemented to BSC. This EIP changes the functionality of the `SELFDESTRUCT` opcode. The new functionality will be only to send all Ether in the account to the target, except that the current behaviour is preserved when `SELFDESTRUCT` is called in the same transaction a contract was created....

items.title: Implement EIP-1153: Transient storage opcodes
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: As part of Cancun upgrade, EIP-1153: Transient storage opcodes is required to be implemented to BSC. This proposal introduces transient storage opcodes, which manipulate state that behaves identically to storage, except that transient storage is discarded after every transaction. In other words, the values of transient storage are never deserialized from storage or serialized to storage. Thus tran...

items.title: Implement EIP-5656: MCOPY
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: As part of Cancun upgrade, EIP-5656: MCOPY is required to be implemented to BSC. Provide an efficient EVM instruction for copying memory areas....

items.title: Validators can produce consecutive blocks
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: <!-- @import "[TOC]" {cmd="toc" depthFrom=1 depthTo=6 orderedList=false} --> Each epoch in BSC consists of multiple slots, and a batch of validators take turns in a predefined order to obtain priority block-producing rights for each slot. This BEP proposes an adjustment to the allocation of priority block-producing rights: each validator receives priority block-producing rights for a predetermined...

items.title: Implement EIP-4844: Shard Blob Transactions
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP proposes introduction of blob-carrying transactions which may contain large amount of data. Introduce a new transaction format for “blob-carrying transactions” which contain a large amount of data that cannot be accessed by EVM execution, but whose commitment can be accessed. The format is intended to be fully compatible with the format that will be used in full sharding....

items.summary: <!-- @import "[TOC]" {cmd="toc" depthFrom=1 depthTo=6 orderedList=false} --> The proposed BEP introduces a new implementation of a graceful exit and forced exit mechanism for storage providers (SP)...

items.title: Greenfield CrossChain Permission Module
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: <!-- @import "[TOC]" {cmd="toc" depthFrom=1 depthTo=6 orderedList=false} --> Currently, Greenfield supports creating buckets and groups from the smart contracts deployed on BSC/opBNB. This means that the owner of a bucket can be a contract address. However, contract addresses cannot upload objects or put policies under the bucket, resulting in empty buckets owned by smart contracts....

items.title: BNB Chain Fusion
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP proposes to securely and smoothly transit the BNB Beacon Chain and BNB Smart Chain (BSC) from a dual-chain structure into a single chain...

items.title: Bundle Format for Greenfield
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP proposes a solution for better on-chain storage efficiency and user experience in Greenfield by introducing a method to bundle small files together before uploading. The new system will reduce storage space and costs caused...

items.title: Builder API Specification for BNB Smart Chain
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP introduces a suite of interaction processes and API specifications to establish a fairer and more transparent MEV framework on the BNB Smart Chain. Participants can follow this specification to collaborate on building and...

items.title: Optimize the incentive mechanism of the Fast Finality feature
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: <!-- @import "[TOC]" {cmd="toc" depthFrom=1 depthTo=6 orderedList=false} --> This BEP proposes three optimizations to the incentive mechanism of the Fast Finality feature in BSC....

items.title: Announce EIP-6049: Deprecate SELFDESTRUCT
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: As part of Shanghai upgrade, EIP-6049: Deprecate SELFDESTRUCT is required to be announced in the BSC community. This EIP deprecates the `SELFDESTRUCT` opcode and warns against its use. A breaking change to this functionality is likely to come in the future....

items.title: Implement EIP-3651: Warm COINBASE
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: As part of Shanghai upgrade, EIP-3651: Warm COINBASE is required to be implemented to BSC. The `COINBASE` address shall be warm at the start of transaction execution, in accordance with the actual cost of reading that account....

items.title: Token Migration after BC Fusion
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: After the Beacon Chain fusion, certain digital assets remain on the Beacon Chain. This proposal presents a secure and trustless solution for users to recover their assets on the BSC once the BC stops running. Before the discontinuation of operations on the Beacon Chain, it is highly recommended that users promptly transfer their assets to other networks through cross-chain transactions. Once BC ce...

items.title: BSC Native Governance Module
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: Native Governance is incorporating governance logic into the BNB Smart Chain instead of delegating this responsibility to the BNB Beacon Chain. BSC Native Governance is a primary goal for the BNB Chain Fusion. The proposal allows community members to submit proposals directly on the BSC network. Any staking credit holders are allowed to vote on these proposals, and the passed proposals will be exe...

items.title: BSC Native Staking after BC Fusion
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: Native Staking module is incorporating staking logic into the BNB Smart Chain(BSC) and moving this responsibility off the BNB Beacon Chain. The proposal allows BNB holders to stake BNB to the specified validators and get staking rewards on the BSC side directly.  After staking, delegators will receive staking credit tokens as a tangible proof of their stake. Staking credit is a token that represen...

items.title: Greenfield Link to opBNB
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP proposes to enable the cross-chain communication between Greenfield and opBNB. Improving programmable capabilities on different platforms allows us to leverage the unique advantages of each platform....

items.title: Beacon Chain Asset Reconciliation for Security Enhancement
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP proposes implementing on-chain asset reconciliation on BNB Beacon Chain to improve security. As a beacon chain, the BNB Beacon Chain plays a vital role in securing the BNB chain ecosystem. Although some...

items.title: Implement EIP-2930: Optional access lists
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: As part of Berlin upgrade, EIP-2930: Optional access lists is required to be implemented to BSC. Adds a transaction type which contains an access list, a list of addresses and storage keys that the transaction plans to access. Accesses outside the list are possible, but become more expensive....

items.title: Implement EIP-2929 Gas cost increases for state access opcodes
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: As part of Berlin upgrade, EIP-2929 Gas cost increases for state access opcodes is required to be implemented to BSC. Increases gas cost for `SLOAD`, `*CALL`, `BALANCE`, `EXT*` and `SELFDESTRUCT` when used for the first time in a transaction....

items.title: Implement EIP-2718 Typed Transaction Envelope
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: As part of Berlin upgrade, EIP-2718 Typed Transaction Envelope is required to be implemented to BSC. `TransactionType || TransactionPayload` is a valid transaction and `TransactionType || ReceiptPayload` is a valid transaction receipt where `TransactionType` identifies the format of the transaction and `*Payload` is the transaction/receipt contents, which are defined in future EIPs....

items.title: Prevent deploying contracts starting with 0xEF
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: Disallow new code starting with the `0xEF` byte to be deployed. Code already existing in the account trie starting with `0xEF` byte is not affected semantically by this change. This BEP essentially enables Ethereum's EIP-3541.  The code has been already ported from go-ethereum. What remains is for this BEP to be enabled in a BSC hard fork....

items.title: Add BASEFEE opcode
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: Adds an opcode that gives the EVM access to the block's base fee. This BEP is dependent on BEP-226 (EIP-1559 with base fee of 0). Add a `BASEFEE (0x48)` that returns the value of the base fee of the current block it is executing in....

items.title: Enable EIP-1559 with base fee of 0
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP introduces [EIP-1559](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-1559.md) headers and transactions to BSC but with base fee set to 0. To keep up to date with the latest developments in EVM blockchains it is important to keep the block and transaction structures up to date. New features (such as account abstraction) being introduced...

items.title: Implement EIP2565 ModExp Gas Cost
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: As part of Berlin upgrade, EIP-2565: ModExp Gas Cost is required to be implemented to BSC. This EIP Defines the gas cost of the `ModExp (0x00..05)` precompile....

items.title: CometBFT Light Block Validation
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP introduces a new precompiled contract to validate the [CometBFT](https://docs.cometbft.com/v0.37/introduction/) light blocks. There are some cross-chain requirements between BSC and CometBFT-compatible blockchains, like the `BNB Greenfield` which...

items.title: Implement EIP3860 Limit and meter initcode
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: As part of Shanghai upgrade, EIP-3860: Limit and meter initcode is required to be implemented to BSC. The change introduces a maximum size limit for initcode (MAX_INITCODE_SIZE = 2 * MAX_CODE_SIZE = 49152). Which extended the EIP-170: Contract code size limit...

items.title: Implement EIP-3855: PUSH0 instruction
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: As part of the Shanghai upgrade, EIP-3855: PUSH0 Instruction is required to be implemented to BSC. Introduce the PUSH0 (0x5f) instruction, which pushes the constant value 0 onto the stack....

items.title: Hybrid Mode State Expiry
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP proposes a practical solution to address the problem of increasing world state storage on the BNB Smart Chain, by removing expired storage state. Storage presents a significant challenge for many blockchains, as new blocks are continually generated, and transactions within these blocks could invoke smart contracts that also add more states to the blockchain....

items.title: Node Discovery ENR filtering
items.author: Matus Kysel
items.summary: This BEP introduces node discovery filtering based on ENR records on the BNB Smart Chain. Current implementation of discovery protocol is chain agnostic and does not differentiate between different chains (ETH, BSC, ...). The discover protocol currently gossips peers from networks with different chain ids. This causes a pretty significant slowdown during peer discovery....

items.title: Early Broadcast Mature block for in-turn validators
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: This BEP introduces a new block broadcast strategy for validators to improve the network capacity and stability. Currently, a mined block will not be broadcasted until the timestamp header.Time is reached, even though the mining process is finished. If an in-turn validator spends too much time in the importing phase, it may not have enough time to mine its own block. In extreme cases, it could gen...

items.title: Purpose and Guidelines
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: BEP stands for BNB Chain Evolution Proposal. Each BEP will be a proposal document providing information to the BNB Chain community, including  BNB Beacon Chain, BNB Smart Chain, and opBNB. The BEP should provide a concise technical specification of the feature or improvement and the rationale behind it. Each BEP proposer is responsible for building consensus within the community and documenting di...

items.title: Purpose and Guidelines
items.author: Unknown
items.summary: BEP stands for BNB Chain Evolution Proposal. Each BEP will be a proposal document providing information to the BNB Chain community, including  BNB Beacon Chain, BNB Smart Chain, and opBNB. The BEP should provide a concise technical specification of the feature or improvement and the rationale behind it. Each BEP proposer is responsible for building consensus within the community and documenting di...
